text.p: Let [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline] be a [mathjaxinline]m\times n[/mathjaxinline] matrix. The columns of [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline] span [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^ m[/mathjaxinline] if and only if:

choice.text: For every vector [mathjaxinline]v\in \mathbb R^ m[/mathjaxinline], the equation [mathjaxinline]Ax = v[/mathjaxinline] has exactly one solution
For every vector [mathjaxinline]v\in \mathbb R^ m[/mathjaxinline], the equation [mathjaxinline]Ax = v[/mathjaxinline] has at least one solution
For every vector [mathjaxinline]v\in \mathbb R^ m[/mathjaxinline], the equation [mathjaxinline]Ax = v[/mathjaxinline] has at most one solution
For some vector [mathjaxinline]v\in \mathbb R^ m[/mathjaxinline], the equation [mathjaxinline]Ax = v[/mathjaxinline] has exactly one solution
For some vector [mathjaxinline]v\in \mathbb R^ m[/mathjaxinline], the equation [mathjaxinline]Ax = v[/mathjaxinline] has at least one solution
For some vector [mathjaxinline]v\in \mathbb R^ m[/mathjaxinline], the equation [mathjaxinline]Ax = v[/mathjaxinline] has at most one solution

font.p: In order for the columns of [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline] to span [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^ m[/mathjaxinline], every vector [mathjaxinline]v\in \mathbb R^ m[/mathjaxinline] needs to be in the span of the columns. By the previous problem, this is equivalent to having at least one solution to the equation [mathjaxinline]Ax=v[/mathjaxinline] for every vector [mathjaxinline]v \in \mathbb R^ m[/mathjaxinline].
